TopicTitle: QOL suggestion: Map view "Control" also focuses

Articles.Content: A QOL suggestion. In map view you can click on an on rails vessel and select control or focus. When I switch control of a vessel I almost always want to focus on that vessel too. It would be nice to have the control option also focus at the same time. I do like that the map view doesn't change to flight view when control is clicked as I often want to check the orbit/maneuver node/etc before going to flight view.

While on the map view topic, a few suggestions. 

 

When rightclicking a planet we now get the options "focus" and "set as target". I would like if they would include the moons below that, so you could easily select a moon withoud having to zoom in. 

Being able to select a close approach or encounter as camera focus point

When orbit line/vehicle of vessels are close to eachother make it easy to select the right orbit line/vehicle. sometimes strugle to select the right one

also more timewarp options in lower orbits as long as they are over highest object and out of atmosphere (atleast in tracking station without having to switch to stationary vehicle) 

 

Keep information displayed on orbit rail (like being able to lock it). so you can see the effect from manuvre changes on for example closest encounter.
